title: Transformer-based Model for Medical Report Generation
abstract: This work presents a transformer model tailored for medical report automation.

citation_contexts.text: Nguyen et al. demonstrate improved performance over LSTM-based methods.
Transformers have gained popularity in NLP and medical imaging.

title: Graph Neural Networks for Disease Prediction
abstract: We explore the use of GNNs to predict disease progression from patient networks.
claims: First to apply GNNs in this context

citation_contexts.text: Consistent with Wang's prior work on patient graphs.
Unlike Zhang et al., this approach models edge weights explicitly.

title: Self-Supervised Learning for Histopathology
abstract: We introduce a contrastive learning framework for histopathological image classification.

citation_contexts.text: Label scarcity is a known challenge in histopathology.
This aligns with Kim et al.’s previous semi-supervised approaches.

title: A Lightweight CNN for Mobile X-Ray Analysis
abstract: We develop a compact CNN optimized for mobile chest X-ray analysis.

citation_contexts.text: Comparable to Ahmed et al. in resource-constrained settings.
Mobile deployment is increasingly important for remote diagnostics.

title: Contrastive Pretraining for Medical Question Answering
abstract: We apply contrastive learning to improve medical QA model robustness.

citation_contexts.text: Long et al. show the value of contrastive pretraining in QA.
Unlike BERT-based baselines, this approach uses triplet loss.

title: Uncertainty-Aware Deep Learning in Clinical Decision Support
abstract: We integrate uncertainty estimation into DL models for better clinical decision support.

citation_contexts.text: Trust in AI is critical for clinical adoption.
This builds on Li’s work on Bayesian neural networks.

title: Large Language Models in Radiology Report Generation
abstract: We evaluate GPT-style LLMs for generating radiology reports from imaging data.
claims: Preferred by radiologists in blind study

citation_contexts.text: Green et al. show alignment between LLM output and expert preferences.
LLMs are being adapted for various biomedical NLP tasks.

title: Multimodal Learning for Cancer Detection
abstract: We combine imaging and genomic data using a multimodal neural network for cancer diagnosis.

citation_contexts.text: Rahman’s earlier study on genomics aligns with this model’s design.
Previous models treated imaging and genomics separately.

title: Explainable AI for ECG Analysis
abstract: We propose a model that provides interpretable ECG analysis for arrhythmia detection.

citation_contexts.text: Osei et al. have emphasized XAI in medical imaging before.
Interpretability is key in clinical settings.

title: Federated Learning for Distributed Medical Data
abstract: We implement a privacy-preserving federated learning system for training on distributed hospital data.

citation_contexts.text: Federated learning maintains patient confidentiality.
Unlike Lin et al., we use adaptive aggregation.
